div.p: Greetings. I wrote recently to Mr. Gwalther through his son, sharing what I had; I know he shares these with you. Meanwhile, I have learned nothing else of significance; however, I have received what you wished to communicate to me through my brother.

For these, I thank you, as well as for your homilies on the conversion of the eunuch of Candace, which you sent to me, certainly an elegant, pious, and useful work. If I can ever repay you for these and all that you do for me, I will do so gladly and diligently. These young men are in a hurry, so I cannot write more now. One of them lived here for a while with Mr. Musculus, he is a very honest, learned, and pious Belgian; he is traveling to Frankfurt and wishes to see and greet you before he goes, taking advantage of this letter.
Farewell. All of ours send their greetings to you.
Johannes Haller the Elder, always yours.
To the most illustrious Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, the most faithful pastor of the Zurich church, my honorable lord and dearest compatriot.
